condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective preparedness and response to emergency situations regarding CSD (Early warning - early action)

description.narrative: UNICEF provided an adequate health response to the needs of 28,313 IDPs in the Pool region, to 33,000 refugees from CAR and DRC in Likouala region, and to 8,452 asylum-seekers from DRC in the Plateaux region. UNICEF also provided technical and financial assistance to tackle the high prevalence of severe acute malnutrition (2.6 per cent at the national level) through access to the nutrition lifesaving interventions for children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM). | Status:Met | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Updated EWEA CSD (WASH, Nutrition, HIV SMI)
UNICEF-targeted children 6-59 months in humanitarian situations who are vaccinated against measles.
Health care facilities with functioning basic water, sanitation and hygiene facilities
